verses.verse: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and the knowledge of the Holy One is insight.
Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and do not lean on your own understanding.
If any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask God, who gives generously to all without reproach, and it will be given him.
The beginning of wisdom is this: Get wisdom, and whatever you get, get insight.
How much better to get wisdom than gold! To get understanding is to be chosen rather than silver.
The fear of the Lord is instruction in wisdom, and humility comes before honor.
Be not wise in your own eyes; fear the Lord, and turn away from evil.
Whoever walks with the wise becomes wise, but the companion of fools will suffer harm.
A wise man is full of strength, and a man of knowledge enhances his might.
The wise of heart will receive commandments, but a babbling fool will come to ruin.
The way of a fool is right in his own eyes, but a wise man listens to advice.
Do you see a man who is wise in his own eyes? There is more hope for a fool than for him.
The wise will inherit honor, but fools get disgrace.
A fool gives full vent to his spirit, but a wise man quietly holds it back.
The heart of the wise makes his speech judicious and adds persuasiveness to his lips.
The wise lay up knowledge, but the mouth of a fool brings ruin near.
The wisdom of the prudent is to discern his way, but the folly of fools is deceiving.
The wise woman builds her house, but the foolish tears it down with her own hands.
The wise will be called understanding, and sweetness of speech increases persuasiveness.
A wise son makes a glad father, but a foolish son is a sorrow to his mother.
The wise fear the Lord and shun evil, but a fool is hotheaded and yet feels secure.
The tongue of the wise commends knowledge, but the mouths of fools pour out folly.
The lips of the wise spread knowledge; not so the hearts of fools.
The wise in heart are called discerning, and gracious words promote instruction.
Whoever is patient has great understanding, but one who is quick-tempered displays folly.
Even fools are thought wise if they keep silent, and discerning if they hold their tongues.
The wise store up choice food and olive oil, but fools gulp theirs down.
The wise prevail through great power, and those who have knowledge muster their strength.
By wisdom a house is built, and through understanding it is established.
A wise king winnows out the wicked; he drives the threshing wheel over them.
The wise in heart accept commands, but a chattering fool comes to ruin.
The wise woman builds her house, but with her own hands the foolish one tears hers down.
The wise store up knowledge, but the mouth of a fool invites ruin.
The wise inherit honor, but fools get only shame.
The wise don’t make a show of their knowledge, but fools broadcast their foolishness.
The wise don’t engage in empty chatter; what they say helps others grow.
A wise person’s heart guides their mouth and brings forth wise words.
The wise don’t trust in their own understanding but seek God’s guidance.
Wisdom is more precious than rubies; nothing you desire can compare with her.
The wise listen to advice, but fools insist on their own way.
Wisdom brings strength; knowledge gives power.
A wise person avoids quarrels, but a fool is quick to argue.
The wise don’t answer before listening, but fools rush in with words.
Wisdom is a shelter, as money is a shelter, but the advantage of knowledge is this: Wisdom preserves those who have it.
A wise person’s heart directs them toward righteousness, but a fool’s heart leads to sin.
The words of the wise are like goads, their collected sayings like firmly embedded nails.
Wisdom makes one wise person more powerful than ten rulers in a city.
Wisdom brightens a person’s face and changes its hard appearance.
Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge, but whoever hates correction is stupid.
The wise don’t flaunt their wisdom, but fools expose their folly.
A wise son heeds his father’s instruction, but a mocker does not respond to rebukes.
The wise don’t speak just to hear themselves, but fools can’t restrain their words.
Wisdom’s instruction is to fear the Lord, and humility comes before honor.
The wise think before they act; fools don’t—and even brag about their foolishness.
A wise person seeks knowledge, but the mouth of a fool feeds on folly.
The wise don’t trust in wealth but in the Lord who gives all things.
Wisdom is found on the lips of the discerning, but a rod is for the back of one who has no sense.
The wise don’t make hasty decisions; they weigh their options carefully.
Wisdom brings joy to those who have understanding, but fools are consumed by their own schemes.
A wise person’s words are gracious, but a fool’s speech destroys.
The wise don’t seek revenge; they leave justice to the Lord.
Wisdom is better than weapons of war, but one sinner destroys much good.
The wise keep their knowledge to themselves, but a fool’s heart blurts out folly.
Wisdom is a tree of life to those who embrace her; happy are those who hold her tightly.
A wise person controls their temper; a fool shows their annoyance at once.
The wise don’t answer a fool according to his folly, or they will be like him.
Wisdom is too high for fools; in the assembly at the gate they must not open their mouths.
The wise don’t rely on their own insight but acknowledge God in all their ways.
Wisdom is sweet to the soul; if you find it, there is a future hope for you.
The wise don’t envy the wicked but trust in the Lord’s justice.
Wisdom is more profitable than silver and yields better returns than gold.
The wise don’t make friends with hot-tempered people, or they may learn their ways.
Wisdom brings long life, wealth, and honor.
The wise don’t speak rashly; they weigh their words carefully.
Wisdom is a fountain of life to those who have it, but folly brings punishment to fools.
The wise don’t trust in their own strength but in the Lord’s power.
Wisdom is better than jewels, and all you may desire cannot compare with her.
The wise don’t seek their own glory but give honor where it is due.
Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom, and with all your getting, get understanding.
The wise don’t despise correction, for it leads to life.
Wisdom is a shield to those who walk uprightly.
The wise don’t rejoice in wrongdoing but delight in truth.
Wisdom is justified by her deeds.
The wise don’t rely on human wisdom but on God’s power.
Wisdom is better than strength, though the poor man’s wisdom is despised.
The wise don’t boast about tomorrow, for they do not know what a day may bring.
Wisdom is a shelter, as money is a shelter, but the advantage of knowledge is this: Wisdom preserves those who have it.
The wise don’t answer a fool according to his folly, lest they be like him.
Wisdom is more precious than rubies; nothing you desire can compare with her.
